sentences.text: The '''2025 Irish presidential election''' must take place by Tuesday, 11 November 2025. The incumbent President of Ireland|president, Michael D. Higgins, is term limited, having served the maximum two terms permitted under the Constitution of Ireland. He was elected in 2011 Irish presidential election|2011 with the support of the Labour Party (Ireland)|Labour Party, and in 2018 Irish presidential election|2018 on his own nomination as an Independent politician (Ireland)|independent.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |author=<!-- not stated --> |date= |title=Presidential elections|url=https://www.electoralcommission.ie/presidential-elections/|website= |location= |publisher=Electoral Commission (Ireland)|Electoral Commission|access-date=18 March 2025|quote=Michael D. Higgins, the current President was inaugurated for his second term on the 11 November 2018. This means that the next presidential election is scheduled to take place on or up to 60 days before 11 November 2025.}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.presidentialelection.ie/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Public-Notice-Nomination-of-Candidates-24-September-2018-1.pdf|website=Presidential Election 2018|title=Public Notice Presidential Election 2018 Nomination of Candidates|date=24 September 2018|access-date=28 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180928200713/https://www.presidentialelection.ie/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Public-Notice-Nomination-of-Candidates-24-September-2018-1.pdf|archive-date=28 September 2018|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
references.reason: Cannot connect to host www.presidentialelection.ie:443 ssl:default [Domain name not found]

sentences.text: If a member of the Oireachtas or a County or City council nominate more than one candidate, only the first nomination paper received from them will be deemed valid. and under the Presidential Elections Act 1993. The President of Ireland|president is elected through instant-runoff voting (described in the constitution as proportional representation by means of the single transferable vote). All Irish citizens entered on the current Electoral roll|electoral register are eligible to vote. Candidates who are elected or who reach 12.5% of the vote on their elimination are entitled to a reimbursement of expenses up to €200,000.

references.text: <ref name=1993act/> Presidential elections are conducted in line with Article 12 of the Constitution of Ireland|Constitution<ref name=art12>Article 12 of the Constitution of Ireland. {{cite web|url=http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/eli/cons/en/html|title=Constitution of Ireland|date=October 2015|website=Irish Statute Book|publisher=Attorney General of Ireland|access-date=16 September 2017|archive-date=3 May 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190503055502/http://www.irishstatutebook.ie/eli/cons/en/html|url-status=live}}</ref>

<ref name=1993act>{{cite web|url=https://www.presidentialelection.ie/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/1993-Presidential-Elections-Act-1993-Consolidated-January-2016.pdf|title=Presidential Elections Act 1993|website=Irish Presidential Election|publisher=Presidential Returning Officer|access-date=21 September 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180921153354/https://www.presidentialelection.ie/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/1993-Presidential-Elections-Act-1993-Consolidated-January-2016.pdf|archive-date=21 September 2018|url-status=dead|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
